definitions.definition: To regard (someone or something) as horrifying or detestable ; to feel great repugnance toward.
examples: I absolutely abhor being stuck in traffic jams.

definitions.definition: To fill with horror or disgust .
definitions.dating_raw: Attested from the mid 16 century until the early 17 century.

definitions.definition: To turn aside or avoid; to keep away from; to reject.
To protest against; to reject solemnly .
To feel horror, disgust , or dislike (towards); to be contrary or averse (to); construed with from .
definitions.dating_raw: Attested from the mid 16 century until the mid 17 century.
Attested from the mid 16 century until the late 17 century.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To regard (someone or something) as horrifying or detestable ; to feel great repugnance toward. [First attested from around (1350 to 1470).]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete , impersonal ) To fill with horror or disgust . [Attested from the mid 16 century until the early 17 century.]
( transitive ) To turn aside or avoid; to keep away from; to reject.
( transitive , canon law , obsolete ) To protest against; to reject solemnly .
( intransitive , obsolete ) To feel horror, disgust , or dislike (towards); to be contrary or averse (to); construed with from . [Attested from the mid 16 century until the mid 17 century.]
( intransitive , obsolete ) Differ entirely from. [Attested from the mid 16 century until the late 17 century.]
